comments.body:
**Audit PR Docs**: Pre-existing drift risks found in full doc audit.

The following sections of this document contain specific line numbers that will go stale as code evolves:

1. **GraphQL Source** (lines 31-33): References `graphql_queries.py` at lines 75, 148, 197 — these line numbers will drift as the file changes.

2. **Display Logic** (line 47): References `lifecycle.py:61-140` — also **inaccurate**: `format_lifecycle_with_status()` starts at line 69, not 61. Should use name-based source pointer instead.

3. **Wiring in real.py** (lines 64-66): References specific line numbers 612, 639, 731 in `real.py` — will drift as code changes.

Suggested fix: Replace line-number references with name-based source pointers per `docs/learned/documentation/source-pointers.md`:
```markdown
<!-- Source: path/to/file.py, SymbolName.method -->
See `SymbolName.method()` in `path/to/file.py`.
```
